div.head: Prologue
div.p: Prologue of the bishop friar Bartolom√© de las Casas or Casaus to the very powerful and most Christian lords of the Royal Council of the Indies.

Your Majesty sent me to call this Royal Council of the Indies about a Confessional I wrote which governs the confessors in hearing the confessions of the Spanish in my diocese. Some say that, from some of the rules in the Confessional, it could be inferred that the monarchs of Castilla have no title, or no good title, to the empire in the Indies. And it seemed to Your Majesty that I should declare in writing what I feel of this matter, for on various occasions in this Royal Council I have spoken in favor of my Confessional.

This is a matter of great importance, and to give an account of it requires a long treatise, since it would need to come from expert men and excellent people. I have begun to collect what over the years I have thought and studied of it. However, since Your Majesty urges me to quickly send my position on the matter, it seemed best to do what I can, following the law of God, in a much abbreviated fashion. Therefore I write these Propositions, without proving them, in the current summary. Their proofs, with the rest, will be part of the said treatise4, which will be presented to Your Majesty in this Royal Council in brief days, should it please God. And because treating this subject necessarily requires discussing things concerning our holy faith, I submit everything I write herein to the correction of the Holy Roman Church.
